Description: Neck and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery belly amphora; exterior: upper part glazed; two narrow bands below and lotus and palmette band, overlapped by black-figure Corinthian helmet crest to right, with added red around edge.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1899,0721.3 by the Priam Painter.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 214, no. B42) (Listed as NA234)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0007) (Phase 1)
